org.formix.dsx

Class XmlElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.formix.dsx.XmlElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    XmlBloc, XmlContent

    public class XmlElement
extends Object
implements XmlContent
    Define an Xml node in an XML document.
    Author:
    jpgravel

      • create

        public static XmlElement create(String name)
        Creates a new XmlElement.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the node to create.
        Returns:
        A new XmlElement.

      • readXML

        public static XmlElement readXML(File file)
                          throws XmlException
        Reads an XmlElement from the given file. Every sub child xml content will be recurseively created.
        Parameters:
        file - The file containing the XmlElement.
        Returns:
        A new XmlElement.
        Throws:
        XmlException - If there is any problem during Xml parsing.

      • readXML

        public static XmlElement readXML(Reader reader)
                          throws XmlException
        Reads an XmlElement from the given reader. Every sub child xml content will be recurseively created.
        Parameters:
        reader - The reader containing the XmlElement.
        Returns:
        A new XmlElement.
        Throws:
        XmlException - If there is any problem during Xml parsing.

      • readXML

        public static XmlElement readXML(Reader reader,
                                 XmlContentListener listener)
                          throws XmlException
        Read XML from the given reader and fire events from the provided listener.
        Parameters:
        reader - The reader containing the XML data.
        listener - The XmlContentListener containing code to be notified each time an Xml content object is created.
        Returns:
        The XmsElement created by parsing the given reader data.
        Throws:
        XmlException - Thrown if a problem occur while reading the provided XML data.

      • readXML

        public static XmlElement readXML(String xml)
                          throws XmlException
        Parse the given xml string into an XmlElement.
        Parameters:
        xml - The XML string to parse.
        Returns:
        The XmlElement parsed from the given XML string.
        Throws:
        XmlException - Thrown if a problem occur while reading the provided XML data.

      • deepEquals

        public boolean deepEquals(XmlElement o)
        Compare the actual XmlElement along whit it's childs.
        Parameters:
        o - The other element to do the comparison with.
        Returns:
        True if bots XmlElements are equals, contains the same number of childs and all those childs are equal to each other, recursively.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object o)
        Two XmlElements are equals if they have the same name, the same number of attributes and all those attributes contains the same values. Sub-elements are not compared.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        o - The object to do the comparison with.
        Returns:
        true if both XmlElement are equal, false otherwise.

      • getChilds

        public List<XmlContent> getChilds()
        Gets this XmlContent instance child list.
        Returns:
        This XmlContent child list.

      • getValue

        public String getValue(String elementName)
        Concatenate all child's XmlContent.toString() trimmed and separated by a single space of the named XmlElement.

        for example:
        given the following XML hierarchy: - root - child - "string value"

        Executing:
        root.getValue("child")

        Will return:
        "string value"

        Parameters:
        elementName - The name of the child element for which we want the inner value.
        Returns:
        The content of the named child element.

      • getElement

        public XmlElement getElement(String name)
        Return the first occurence of the named child XmlElement.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the desired child element.
        Returns:
        The named element or null if there is no such child XmlElement.

      • getElement

        public XmlElement getElement(String name,
                             int index)
        Gets the named child element at the given index.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the child XmlElement desired.
        index - The index of the desired XmlElement.
        Returns:
        The child XmlElement corresponding to the given name at the given index or null if no element is fount at this index.

      • getId

        public long getId()
        Description copied from interface: XmlContent
        Gets the Id of the current node. This id has no representation in the given XML but is useful to uniquely identify each XML node within an XML graph.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface XmlContent
        Returns:
        The Id of the current XML content.
